intro: Ballota vulgaris, commonly known as lesser ballota, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Ballota vulgaris is often found in rocky or dry soils and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
